L - fucose and L - rhamnose are two 6 - deoxyhexoses naturally occurring in several complex carbohydrates.

In prokaryotes both of them are found in polysaccharides of the cell wall, while in animals only L - fucose has been described, which mainly participates to the structure of glycoconjugates, either in the cell membrane or secreted in biological fluids, such as ABH blood groups and Lewis system antigens.
L - fucose and L - rhamnose are synthesized by two de novo biosynthetic pathways starting from GDP - D - mannose and dTDP - D - glucose, respectively, which share several common features.
